title: Liberia: Hazard Pay Strike At Executive Ground
text:
Liberia: Supreme Court Mandates NEC to Re-Run Senatorial Polls in Lower Bong 
Some of the healthcare workers carried placards reading: "All ETU workers need their risk benefit" and "We are here for our risk benefit", among others. They gathered before the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, just before the fence of the University of Liberia amidst police presence. 
"I am here for my risk benefit, I worked with the ETU as a hygienist, delivered and sacrifice myself, and I today have a heart problem according to doctor report which is caused by the chlorine," said Varney Ngobeh , 39, a former volunteer with the government-run ELWA 2 Ebola treatment ward. 
Ngobeh told our reporter that he would use to hazard pay to solve his health and family problems. He claimed that the Ministry of Health and Social Welfare had negotiated with aggrieved healthcare workers to be them US $ 2,500 out of US$5,000 which should have been paid six month ago. He they were growing impatient with authorities. 
"If government refused to give our money from today we will continue this until it leads to destruction and we will not mind if they can killed every one of us," Ngobeh threatened. Tina Harmon explained that she is entitled to her risk benefit as per the contract signed before taking on the job at the ETU. 
"We will start blocking traffic. I want for government to kill me today because me I tire and it is a complete disgrace for government that they should be ashamed of," said Tina Harmon, a former volunteer. 
"We suffered, we got disgrace from our community and we don't have anything to show but only have that stigma behind us," Harmon lamented. "They are reneging in paying our money. That is what they have been doing for the past six months," remarked Elton Tarkue. 
"They should very promptly give us a redress of this issue to avoid any problem," he added. All efforts aimed to contacting the Incident Management System of Liberia's Ebola response proved futile up to press time. Liberia
